notes.note: libssh: Authentication Bypass due to improper message callbacks implementation

reference.description: bz#1614973: CVE-2018-10933 libssh: Authentication Bypass due to improper message callbacks implementation

remediation.description:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.
For details on how to apply this update, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgment.description: Red Hat would like to thank the libssh team for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Peter Winter-Smith (NCC Group) as the original reporter.

note: Updated cockpit packages that fix two bugs are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Extras.

Cockpit is a server administration interface that makes it easy to administer GNU/Linux servers through a web browser.
This update fixes two bugs, including this:
* The cockpit dashboard has been changed to present SHA256 fingerprints instead of MD5 fingerprints when connecting to remote machines through SSH. MD5 fingerprints are cryptographically weak now, and do not work with FIPS mode enabled. (BZ#1585191)
Users of cockpit are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these two bugs.
